item.description:
Time Approximate

Condemned to six years in prison, 19-year-old Malik El Djebena (Tahar Rahim), part Arab, part Corsican, cannot read or write. Arriving at the jail entirely alone, he appears younger and more fragile than the other convicts. Cornered by the leader of the Corsican gang who rules the prison, he is given a number of "missions" to carry out, toughening him up and gaining the gang leader's confidence in the process. But Malik is brave and a fast learner, daring to secretly develop his own plans. Directed and co-written by Jacques Audiard (The Beat That My Heart Skipped, Read My Lips). Academy Award nominee for Best Foreign Language Film.

I'm changing this meetup to Sunday afternoon in the hopes that members who asked for meetups 'in the burbs' might be able to attend..

A Prophet

Director/Co-writer Jacques Audiard



15 Members like this
Venues West of Boston


I'd like to suggest not-infrequent meetups at premium/arthouse theatres such as the Embassy in Waltham, the West Newton Cinema, and others. For those of us west of Boston, be that Newton or MetroWest, in-town attendance is often expensive, traffic-laden, and parking-poor. Frequent service via the "T" or commuter rail doesn't exist.

A regular break out in the 'burbs won't hurt anyone and will help more than a couple of members! Thanks.


See you at the movies,

John
item.name: A Prophet Metrowest
